Art. 4.245 
Nullity 
Any agreement as to succession which is not authorised by law is absolutely null and void.
The same applies to agreements drawn up in disregard of Articles 4.249 to 4.252 and, in the case of an agreement referred to in Articles 4.254 to 4.259, in disregard of those provisions.
However, in the case of an agreement relating to a party's own future succession, the nullity referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 becomes relative nullity on the day of that party's death. Nonetheless, failure to comply with the form imposed by article 4.249 remains subject to absolute nullity.
